metadata.name: PUA - Suspicious ActiveDirectory Enumeration Via AdFind.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects active directory enumeration activity using known AdFind CLI flags

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lockoutduration')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lockoutthreshold')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lockoutobservationwindow')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('maxpwdage')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('minpwdage')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('minpwdlength')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('pwdhistorylength')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('pwdproperties')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-sc admincountdmp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-sc exchaddresses'))))

output.summary: Detects active directory enumeration activity using known AdFind CLI flags

metadata.objective: False positive: Authorized administrative activity References: https://www.joeware.net/freetools/tools/adfind/, https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/7535.adfind-command-examples.aspx, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1087.002/T1087.002.md
